titles.ar: باب الْمَرْأَةِ تَكُونُ فِي الصَّلَاةِ فَتَحُسُّ بِالْحَيْضِ
titles.en: Chapter 17 – The woman happens to be in the Salaat, so she feels the menstruation (Haydh)

titles.ar: باب الْحَائِضِ تَقْضِي الصَّوْمَ وَ لَا تَقْضِي الصَّلَاةَ
titles.en: Chapter 18 – The menstruating woman would make up the (missed) Fasts and she would not make up the (missed) Salaats

titles.ar: باب الْمَرْأَةِ تَحِيضُ بَعْدَ دُخُولِ وَقْتِ الصَّلَاةِ قَبْلَ أَنْ تُصَلِّيَهَا أَوْ تَطْهُرُ قَبْلَ دُخُولِ وَقْتِهَا فَتَتَوَانَى فِي الْغُسْلِ
titles.en: Chapter 16 – The woman menstruates after the entry of the time of the Salaat, before she had prayed or was clean before the entry of her time and she procrastinates regarding the washing

titles.ar: باب الْمَرْأَةِ تَكُونُ فِي الصَّلَاةِ فَتَحُسُّ بِالْحَيْضِ
titles.en: Chapter 17 – The woman happens to be in the Salaat, so she feels the menstruation (Haydh)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/247)

parts.text: أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الْمَرْأَةِ تَكُونُ فِي الصَّلَاةِ فَتَظُنُّ أَنَّهَا قَدْ حَاضَتْ

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ مُصَدِّقِ بْنِ صَدَقَةَ عَنْ عَمَّارِ بْنِ مُوسَى عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الْمَرْأَةِ تَكُونُ فِي الصَّلَاةِ فَتَظُنُّ أَنَّهَا قَدْ حَاضَتْ قَالَ

text: تُدْخِلُ يَدَهَا فَتَمَسُّ الْمَوْضِعَ فَإِنْ رَأَتْ شَيْئاً انْصَرَفَتْ وَ إِنْ لَمْ تَرَ شَيْئاً أَتَمَّتْ صَلَاتَهَا .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Ahmad, from Ahmad Bin Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Amro Bin Saeed, from Musaddaq Bin Sadaqa, from Ammar Bin Musa,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws regarding the woman who happens to be in the Salaat, so she thinks that she has menstruated. Heasws said: ‘She should insert her hand and touch the place. So if she sees something, she would leave (the Salaat), and if she does not see anything, she would complete her Salaat’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from Ahmad ibn al-Hassan ibn Ali from ‘Amr ibn Sa‘id from Musaddiq ibn Sadaqah from ‘Ammar ibn Musa who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a woman who thinks it is blood discharge during performing Salah (prayer). He (the Imam) said, ‘She must feel with her hand. If it is blood discharge, she must discontinue, and if she does not find anything, she must complete her Salah (prayer).”’ (The above Hadith is best explained in the form of fatwa.)
